question.text: An ionized gas contains both positive and negative ions. If it is subjected simultaneously to an electric field along the <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mo>+</mo><mi>x</mi></math> direction and a magnetic field along the <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mo>+</mo><mi>z</mi></math> direction, then

options.text: Positive ions deflect towards +y direction and negative ions towards -y direction
Positive ions deflect towards -y direction and negative ions towards +y direction

solution.text: As electric field will accelerate +ve charge along +ve x- axis and -ve charge along -ve x axis from <math> <mrow> <mover accent="true"> <mtext>F</mtext> <mo>→</mo> </mover> <mo>=</mo> <mtext>q</mtext> <mfenced close=")" open="(" separators=","> <mrow> <mover accent="true"> <mtext>v</mtext> <mo>→</mo> </mover> <mo>×</mo> <mover accent="true"> <mtext>B</mtext> <mo>→</mo> </mover> </mrow> </mfenced> </mrow> </math> direction of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>q</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mover><mi>V</mi><mo>→</mo></mover><mo>×​</mo><mover><mi>B</mi><mo>→</mo></mover><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>  will be same for both of them i.e. <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mo>-</mo><mi>ve</mi><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">y</mi></math> direction so both will deflect towards <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mo>-</mo><mi>ve</mi><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">y</mi></math> direction.
